name: Alluring Voice
effects: After this Move has resolved, the user may choose to Confuse foes within 5m that have had any CS raised since the beginning of that foe’s last turn. This Effect may trigger only once per Scene.

name: Aqua Cutter
effects: This Move is a Critical Hit on 18+.

name: Aqua Step
effects: Raise the user’s Speed 1 Combat Stage.

name: Armor Cannon
effects: The user's Defense and Special Defense are each lowered by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Artillerolives
effects: Once per Scene, you may create Slick Hazards in two Blasts 3, anywhere within range. If used on only 1 target, this Move gains the Double Strike keyword, and if Slick Hazards are created, you may create them in a single Blast 5, centered on the target. The user may ignore Slick Hazards and does not have to stop shifting or become Vulnerable from them.

name: Axe Kick
effects: Confuses the target on 15+. If this Move misses, the user loses Hit Points equal to 1/4th of their Max Hit Points. A failure to hit due to a Move with the Shield keyword does not count as a miss. This Move cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

name: Beckon
effects: The target immediately Shifts towards the user, forfeiting their next Shift Action. This movement does not provoke Attacks of Opportunity. On 17+, the target additionally is Infatuated with the user and Trapped.

name: Bitter Blade
effects: After the target takes damage, the user gains HP equal to half of the damage they dealt to the target.

name: Blazing Torque
effects: Burns all legal targets on 15+.

name: Blood Moon
effects: After dealing damage, the user becomes Slowed and Vulnerable until the end of their next turn.

name: Brutal Beatdown
effects: The user’s Defense and Special Defense are each lowered by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Burning Bulwark
effects: If the user is hit by an attack, the user may use this Move. The user is instead not hit by the attack. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the attack’s effects. In addition, if the triggering attack was Melee ranged, the attacker is Burned.

name: Butterfly Knife
effects: If this Move is used successfully and consecutively on the same target, the Damage Base is increased by +4 to a maximum of 16. For example, the first hit would have a DB of 4; the second hit a DB of 8; the third hit a DB of 12; the fourth and further hits a DB of 16. If this Move misses or fails to damage its target, its Damage Base resets.

name: Chilling Water
effects: The target cannot make Attacks of Opportunity for 1 full round and their Attack is lowered by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Chilly Reception
effects: The weather changes to Snowy for 5 rounds and the user may immediately be recalled in the same turn. A new Pokémon may immediately be sent out. Using this Move lets a Trapped user be recalled. If the user is not recalled, their movement this turn does not provoke Attacks of Opportunity instead.

name: Clayball
effects: The user may push the target up to 2 meters away.

name: Collision Course
effects:
Create Slow Terrain in all squares the user Shifted through during Pass, and in a Burst 1 around the user after finishing movement. The user may ignore this Slow Terrain.
Whenever this Move deals Super-Effective Damage to a target, that target treats your Damage Roll as if it was increased by +10.

name: Combat Torque
effects: Paralyzes all legal targets on 15+.

name: Comeuppance
effects: This Move may be used as a Reaction when the user is hit by a damaging attack. Resolve the triggering attack, with the user resisting the attack one step further. After the attack is resolved, if the user was not Fainted, the triggering foe then loses Hit Points equal to the amount of Hit Points lost by the user from the triggering attack. The triggering foe then becomes Tripped and you may choose 2 allies. The chosen allies may Disengage 2 meters towards the triggering foe as a Free Action.

name: Crush
effects: The target becomes Infatuated with the user on 17+.

name: Disorient
effects: Confuses the target on 19+.

name: Doodle
effects: The user gains 1 Ability of their choice from the target, and may also grant that Ability to an ally within range, both for the remainder of the encounter. This Move cannot miss.

name: Double Shock
effects: If the user is an Electric Type, they lose the Electric Type until the start of their next turn. Pure electric-types become Normal-type instead of becoming typeless.

name: Dragon Cheer
effects: Blessing - Any user affected by this Blessing may activate it when making a successful attack to turn the attack into a Critical Hit against one legal target of their choice. The Blessing may be activated 2 times, then disappears. The first time a Scene a Dragon-Type Pokémon activates this Blessing, that activation does not count towards this limit.

name: Electro Drift
effects:
After dealing damage, the user may Disengage 4 meters in a straight line.
Whenever this Move deals Super-Effective Damage to a target, that target treats your Damage Roll as if it was increased by +10.

name: Electro Shot
effects: For 1 round, any ally that enters a square adjacent to the user, or starts movement there, may Disengage into any square of the Area of Effect of this Move without expending Movement, and then continue their Shift. If the user is in Rainy Weather, this Move is a Standard Action.

name: Fey Wild
effects: The user’s Defense and Special Defense are each lowered by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Fickle Beam
effects: Roll Accuracy for this Move 3 times. For each target, if one of these rolls succeeds, this Move hits that target. For each successful roll after the first, choose one of the following additional effects:» That target is Slowed for 1 full round.» That target is Suppressed.If one or more of the rolls crit, this Move is a Critical Hit.This Move is 1 step more effective against targets that have hit the user for Super Effective damage since the beginning of their last turn.

name: Fillet Away
effects:
The next successful damaging Psychic attack made by the user is automatically a Critical Hit. The user may sacrifice three Ticks of Hit Points. If they do so, choose one:  
» Fillet Away becomes a Swift Action.
» An adjacent Ally gains 3 Ticks of Temporary Hit Points.

name: Fissure
effects: This Move automatically Critically Hits targets at or below half of their Max Hit Points. After dealing damage, the target becomes Trapped until the end of their next turn.

name: Flash Step
effects: This Move cannot miss. Before attacking, the user may Teleport 4 into a square adjacent to a foe as a Shift Action.

name: Flower Trick
effects: This Move cannot miss. If this Move hits, it is a Critical Hit.

name: Gigaton Hammer
effects: After dealing damage, the user becomes Slowed and Vulnerable until the end of their next turn.

name: Glaive Rush
effects:
On hit, you may choose to become Vulnerable for 1 full round. If you do, this attack is one step more effective. 
Additionally, the next successful damaging attack against you while Vulnerable this way is automatically a Critical Hit.

name: Glint
effects: The target cannot make Attacks of Opportunity for 1 full round and their Attack is lowered by -1 Combat Stage.

name: Guillotine
effects: This Move automatically Critically Hits targets at or below half of their Max Hit Points. After dealing damage, the target becomes Vulnerable for one full round.

name: Hard Press
effects: If the target’s Hit Points are above 50%, this Move’s Damage Base is doubled to Damage Base 12 (3d12+10 / 30).

name: Horn Drill
effects: This Move automatically Critically Hits targets at or below half of their Max Hit Points. The target’s next damaging attack calculates damage as though it were one step less Effective. This counts as a Volatile Affliction.

name: Hydro Steam
effects: This Move does not deal reduced damage in Sunny Weather. It instead deals +10 damage in Sunny Weather.

name: Hyper Drill
effects: Blessings or Moves with the Shield keyword may not be activated in response to this Move.

name: Ice Spinner
effects: All targets are Tripped on a roll of 18+. If the user moves through an area of Terrain, or a Field-range Terrain is active, those effects immediately end.

name: Icebreaker
effects: You may use this Move as if it had the Priority and Pass keywords in the first round after joining an encounter. Switching out resets this requirement.

name: Ivy Cudgel
effects: Ivy Cudgel may be any Type the user currently possesses. Ivy Cudgel is a critical hit on a roll of 18+.

name: Kowtow Cleave
effects: Kowtow Cleave cannot miss.

name: Last Respects
effects:
This Move gains additional Effects depending on the number of allies that have Fainted this Scene. These Effects are cumulative.
- The target is Flinched on 15+.
- The target is Cursed on 17+.
- This Move gains Smite.
Once per Scene, this Move may Deal damage of a Type of any of the Fainted allies instead of Ghost. This does not affect whether this Move gains STAB or not.

name: Lumina Crash
effects: The target’s Special Defense is lowered by -2 Combat Stages.

name: Magical Torque
effects: Confuses all legal targets on 15+

name: Make It Rain
effects: The user’s Special Attack is lowered by -1 Combat Stage. Once per Day, this Move scatters metal coins equal in value to 1d8 times the user’s Level. If it is a trainer battle, the winner gets to pick up the coins.

name: Malignant Chain
effects: The target is Poisoned. Then, choose an ally. That ally and the target become Linked to each other. Whenever the Linked ally takes damage, the Linked foe loses a Tick of Hit Points. This effect ends when the user is Fainted.

name: Matcha Gotcha
effects: After the targets take damage, choose one of the targets, the user gains HP equal to half of the damage they dealt to that target. Matcha Gotcha Burns all Legal Targets on 17+.

name: Mighty Cleave
effects: The user gains +10 Damage Reduction for 1 full round. Interrupts may not be activated in response to this Move.

name: Mortal Spin
effects: This Move destroys all Hazards  within a Burst 5 that were placed by foes, removes Leech Seeds, and removes the user’s Trapped or Stuck conditions. All targets that are hit are Poisoned.

name: Mould
effects: Once a Scene, if Mould's target has a Status Affliction, you may have Mould's Damage Base be 13 instead (4d10+10 / 35)

name: Mudslide
effects: Choose a direction. All legal targets are Pushed 2 meters in that direction.

name: Noxious Torque
effects: Poisons all targets on 15+.

name: Occult Razor
effects: This Move automatically Critically Hits targets at or below half of their Max Hit Points. After dealing damage, the target becomes Suppressed for 1 full round.

name: Order Up
effects: If the user, target, an Attached Commander or a pokemon Grappled by the user has a Food Buff, you may consume one of those Buffs (ignoring its normal trigger condition), gain its effects, and this attack is one step more effective. The target cannot activate Food Buffs in response to this Move.

name: Population Bomb
effects:
Roll Accuracy for this Move 3 times. If one of these rolls succeeds, this Move hits. For each successful roll after the first, choose one of the following additional effects:
» The target is Vulnerable until the end of their next turn.
» The target's Moves are resisted 1 step further until the end of their next turn.
» This Move's damage cannot be resisted.
If one or more of the rolls crit, this Move is a Critical Hit, and you may choose an additional effect.

name: Pounce
effects: After dealing damage, the target is Slowed for 1 round. A target may only be Slowed by this Move once per Scene. Special: Grants Overland and Long Jump +1

name: Psy Kick
effects: The user may push the target up to 2 meters.

name: Psyblade
effects: This move deals +10 damage if the user or targets are in Electric Terrain.

name: Psychic Noise
effects: Choose a legal target. The chosen target may not gain Hit Points or Temporary Hit Points from any source, until it is switched out. This counts as a Volatile Affliction.

name: Rage Fist
effects: If the user has at least 1 Injury when using this Move, its Damage Base gets doubled to DB 10 (3d8+10 / 24). Additionally, if the user is under 50% Max HP, this Move instead becomes DB 12 (3d12+10 / 30) and cannot miss.

name: Raging Bull
effects: As a Free Action, the user may change this Move's Type to any Type that the user possesses. Blessings may not be activated in response to this Move.

name: Redline
effects: The target may not make Attacks of Opportunity until the end of the Round. If the target has any positive Combat Stages, it loses them, and this Move is 1 step more Effective. After attacking, the user may Move up to their remaining Movement as a Free Action.

name: Revival Blessing
effects: An ally that Fainted this Scene may use a Move as a Free Action as if they were not Fainted, originating from a square adjacent to the user. The chosen ally may be a Pokémon in a Poké Ball.

name: Ruination
effects: The target loses 1/2 of their current Hit Points.

name: Salt Cure
effects: The target becomes Lightly Salted as a Volatile Affliction. While Lightly Salted, they lose 1 Tick of HP at the beginning of each of their turns. Water and Steel-Type Pokemon hit by Salt Cure lose 2 Ticks of HP instead.

name: Shed Tail
range: Self, Coat, Illusion, Interrupt, Shield, Trigger
effects:
If the user is hit by a Move while above 1/4th Hit Points, after being told how much damage it would deal, they may use this Move.
The user is instead not hit by the triggering Move, and does not take any damage, nor are they affected by any of the Move’s effects. Instead, they lose 1/4th of their maximum Hit Points. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented in any way.
The user may then Disengage up to their full Movement as a Free Action, or be switched out, even if they are Trapped. They leave behind a Tail Token on any one square they occupied.
The Tail Token counts as Rough Terrain for foes, and if an ally Shifts over it, they may remove it from the field to gain the same amount of Temporary Hit Points as the user lost when activating this Move.
This Move may not be activated against Moves with the Sonic keyword.

name: Sheer Cold
effects: This Move automatically Critically Hits targets at or below half of their Max Hit Points.The target becomes Slowed. This effect does not affect Ice-Types. On a 16+ they are instead Frozen

name: Silk Trap
effects: If the user is hit by a Move, the user may use this Move. The user is instead not hit by the triggering Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move’s effects. In addition, if the triggering Move was Melee ranged, the attacker's Speed is lowered by -2 Combat Stages and they are Slowed until the end of the user's next turn. If the target already has negative Speed Combat Stages, the target is Stuck and Trapped instead of Slowed.

name: Snowscape
effects: The weather changes to Snowy for 5 rounds. While it is Snowing, all Ice-Type Pokémon gain 5 Damage Reduction, or +2 to any existing Damage Reduction.

name: Spicy Extract
effects: Choose either Attack or Special Attack. Raise the chosen Stat of the user or an ally within range by +3 Combat Stages. You cannot make the same choice twice in the same Scene.

name: Spin Out
effects: This Move may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line and ended in range of a target. When used this way, this Move gains the Smite keyword, and lowers the user's Speed by -2 Combat Stages.

name: Spook
effects: Lower the target’s Special Defense by -1 Combat Stage on 18+.

name: Substitute
range: Self, Coat, Illusion, Interrupt, Shield, Trigger
effects:
If the user is hit by a Move while above 1/4th Hit Points, after being told how much damage it would deal, they may use this Move.
The user is instead not hit by the triggering Move, and does not take any damage, nor are they affected by any of the Move’s effects. Instead, they lose 1/4th of their maximum Hit Points. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented in any way.
The user then gains an Illusory Coat that prevents them from suffering any effects from foes' actions, except Damage and direct Hit Point loss. Sonic Moves ignore this Coat, and this Move may not be activated against them.

name: Sugar Rush
effects: The user Shifts before or after attacking, ignoring Slow Terrain. If the user did not move through Slow Terrain during this Shift, raise the user’s Speed 1 Combat Stage.

name: Supercell Slam
effects: If this Move misses, the user loses Hit Points equal to 1/4th of their Max Hit Points. A failure to hit due to a Move with the Shield keyword does not count as a miss. This Move cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

name: Surge
effects: The target cannot make Attacks of Opportunity for 1 full round.

name: Syrup Bomb
effects: The target and all foes adjacent to them are Slowed for 1 full Round. If an affected foe was already Slowed or Stuck, it becomes Stuck instead.

name: Tachyon Cutter
effects: If the targets are not adjacent to each other, this Move cannot miss.

name: Temper Flare
effects: If the user's last attack failed or missed, this move is DB 15 (4d10+10 / 45) instead.

name: Tera Blast
effects: If the user is Terastalized, this move’s Type becomes the user’s Tera Type.

name: Tera Starstorm
effects:
Place a Star Shard in any square of the Area of Effect. Any ally entering that square, or starting their turn on it, may consume the Shard to gain a +10 Damage Bonus on their next successful damaging attack.
If a target has changed Forme, this attack is one step more effective against that target. This may not cause the Effectiveness to be raised above Doubly Super Effective.

name: Thunderclap
effects: If a foe within Range uses a damaging Move, or leaves Range, the user may use this Move as an Interrupt against that foe. If they do, the target receives a -10 damage penalty to its next Move, or the triggering one, if any.

name: Tidy Up
effects: Choose Slow or Rough Terrain. The chosen Terrain, any Terrain Effects of your choice caused by Moves, and all Hazards are removed from the squares within a Burst 4. Then, the user's Attack and Speed are raised by +1 Combat Stage.

name: Torch Song
effects: Raise the Special Attack of either the user or an ally within 3 meters by +1 Combat Stage.

name: Trailblaze
effects: The user Shifts before or after attacking, ignoring Slow Terrain. If the user did not move through Slow Terrain during this Shift, raise the user’s Speed 1 Combat Stage.

name: Triple Dive
effects: After attacking, hit or miss, the user may Disengage 2 meters and attack a different target with this Move. This effect may be repeated a second time, targeting a creature that has not been targeted by either prior attack. Before making each Accuracy Check, the user can elect to give up triggering all remaining additional Shifts and attacks. This Move gains +5 to its damage roll for each attack that is given up.

name: Twin Beam
effects: If used on only 1 target, this Move gains the Double Strike keyword.

name: Upper Hand
effects:
If an adjacent foe declares Priority or an Interrupt, this Move may be used as an Interrupt against the triggering foe. If used this way, this Move Flinches the target.
If the triggering Interrupt was itself triggered by the user’s Standard Action, that Action is relinquished, in favor of giving up the Action on the following round, to use this Move.

name: Wave Dash
effects: The user may make the Disengage Maneuver as a Free Action either right before or after using this Move.

name: Wicked Torque
effects: The user may use their Shift action to move anywhere within the Blast without provoking opportunity attacks. On a 17+, all legal targets fall Asleep.

name: Wither
effects: Suppresses all legal targets on 15+. Any foes adjacent to the target lose 10 Hit Points.

name: Zantetsuken
effects: This Move automatically Critically Hits targets at or below half of their Max Hit Points. After dealing damage, the target becomes Vulnerable for one full round.
